intro: Calochortus catalinae, commonly known as Catalina mariposa, is a flowering plant native to the Channel Islands off the coast of California. It is a member of the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal scrub and grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces basal leaves and has a short, upright stem. Calochortus catalinae is known for its resilience to coastal conditions and is often found in sunny, open areas.
